item.title: Broadcast on 02-Oct-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Christine from Wild Spinach Nature Tours describes Vancouver's local plant life, and Henry from the UBC Cooking Club discusses food labelling, lamb chops and gives us a 3-minute brownie recipe.

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Sep-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Jordie describes the food court at Westminster Quay, Darcy Broatch reviews Deer Garden, and both interview Pippa Mackie about her recent Fringe show Industry: The Food Must Go Out

item.title: Broadcast on 04-Sep-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Brenda and guest host Kendra Loewen interview Happy Farmer Al, the UBC Cooking Club and discuss the best meal of Brenda's life

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Jun-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: Ramen, Unhappy hour, and eating in complete darkness.

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Jun-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: An interview with the authors of This East Van Kitchen, a review of Bestie and discussion of sausages.

item.title: Broadcast on 29-May-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: JJ's Fine Dining, Music Waste, a simple new lunch idea and King's Gate Mall are all discussed this episode.

item.title: Broadcast on 01-May-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: Special in studio performance from Fist Full o' Snacks! And Rob comes on to talk about the Spring Sessional Cask Festival.

item.title: Broadcast on 23-Jan-2014
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Brenda and Jordie discuss 'wooster' sauce and making your own condiments, chat with Seth about mushroom picking, and discuss the ins and outs of mushrooms and spores with expert Andrew Wylie.

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Dec-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Brenda and Jordie discuss all things about pumpkin with Chef Steve Golob, and play christmas covers by local bands

item.title: Broadcast on 28-Nov-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Jay Arner and Jessica Delisle stop by to discuss Mint's Ridiculously Early Xmas Party, Jessica's gross food blog and Rob from Pacific Western Brewing stops by to chat about the Hopscotch Festival

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Oct-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: in which Brenda and guest Julie Colero interview Chef Steve Golob from Vanier dining hall about seasonal recipes, food themes, farmers markets, play music and discuss making borscht.

item.title: Broadcast on 03-Oct-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 39-Marlis and Brenda discuss their travels, Ferdinando joins us to talk about mushroom picking.

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Sep-2013
item.description: in which Brenda and Jordie play local tunes, Darcy and Jordie reflect on their CSA summer, and Steve Golob joins the studio to discuss new food initiatives at UBC.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Jul-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 37-Jordie attempts to review every restaurant on Main Street! Tune in to see how he does.

item.title: Broadcast on 27-Jun-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 35-Ryan joins us to discuss rabbit hunting, Brenda is back, and Jordie and Brenda discuss the BC BBQ championships.

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Jun-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 34 - A Jordie only episode. Much music is played, Jordie and Darcy discuss their CSA in a new segment, and the Spicy Chinese Food Street Kingsway is explored!

item.title: Broadcast on 16-May-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Rebroadcast Episode 32!

item.title: Broadcast on 02-May-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 32 - In which Trevor returns with Drivin' Through to discuss Carl's Jr and Jordie and Brenda discuss the Slow Food Story documentary.

item.title: Broadcast on 18-Apr-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 1-A very special rebroadcast of our first episode ever. Just about an hour in length.

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Mar-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 31 - Featuring new fast food segment Driving Through *Ding Ding* with Trevor, we are joined by PB&J correspondent and Jordie's girlfriend Darcy Broatch to discuss jerky, and olive oil.

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Feb-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 29 - In a very special Valentine's Day episode, Jordie and Brenda play depressing local music about love, interview someone about insulin, and recommend some great shows.

item.title: Broadcast on 31-Jan-2013
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 28 - in which Brenda and Jordie play local music, Darcy and Jordie visit HK BBQ Master, and Shane Nelken discusses his music, dry February and Dark Table.

item.title: Broadcast on 06-Dec-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 27In which Brenda and Jordie discuss Christmas parties and the food and drink you find at them, how to make apple wine, and much music is played.

item.title: Broadcast on 22-Nov-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 26In which Jordie, Darcy and Alex discuss the Hopscotch festival, and Seth brings in pupusas to celebrate Pupusa Day.

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Nov-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 25 - in which Brenda interviews Tim from sandwhich beta, Ben Jordie and Brenda discuss the westender's best of culinary issue, they plug the diamond radioversary party, and adam joins them to talk about the upcoming hopscotch festival.

item.title: Broadcast on 25-Oct-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 24-Jordie is again joined by Jessica. There is some Halloween discussion, Matchstick Coffee, and much music is played.

item.title: Broadcast on 11-Oct-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 23-The Poutine Episode: In which, Jordie is joined by Jessica to discuss poutine, Lucky Peach Magazine, the Oceanwise Chowder Chowdown, Pop Montreal's music and food, and ice cream that looks like other types of food.

item.title: Broadcast on 13-Sep-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 21-In which we talk about Mennonite food, the Tiffin Project, Rifflandia and the Olio Festival.

item.title: Broadcast on 30-Aug-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 20-In which Brenda and Jordie do an alcohol themed show, with special guest Elin Tayyar from Campaign for Culture, a discussion of vodka and talks about some local pubs.

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Aug-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 19 - In which Jordie and Brenda talk about American food trends, Ben tells us about Acorn, Laura talks about a pig roast, and much music is played.

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Jul-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 17

item.title: Broadcast on 05-Jul-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 16 - In which, Vikram Vij talks about Indian Summer with Brenda, Ben of Boogie Monster joins us, Jordie discusses Go Fish's restaurant.

item.title: Broadcast on 21-Jun-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 15 - In which Brenda is away on vacation, but Jordie is back, much music is played, pizza trends are discussed, and pinball is recommended.

item.title: Broadcast on 24-May-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 13 - in which Jordie goes to the optometrist, and Brenda replaces him with Jessica Chau. They discuss the new Richmond night market, Toshi Sushi, Next Music From Tokyo 4, and recommend that you go see Kurt Vile, Needles//Pins and White Lung this w

item.title: Broadcast on 10-May-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 12 - In which, Brenda and Jordie discuss 6 Rules for Dining Out as published in the Atlantic, much music is played, and Trevor Gilks reviews Cork & Fin and debates the best way to buy wine in a restaurant.

item.title: Broadcast on 26-Apr-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 11-in which Jordie shares his NACHO NEWS, Connor Stewart-Hunter interviews the UBC Farm, and Rhonda Wideman discusses her community garden.

item.title: Broadcast on 12-Apr-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 10 -In which chef-in-training David Abe joins us to discuss his schooling, molecular gastronomy, and young Grey brings his dad in.

item.title: Broadcast on 29-Mar-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 9 - Jordie hosts and discusses frozen desserts with Jessica, Brenda talks with Mike from Les Jupes about hotdogs, the Discorder show is discussed a lot

item.title: Broadcast on 15-Mar-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 8 - Jordie and Brenda are joined by 12-year-old Grey, they discuss Mom's Grilled Cheese, La Brasserie, Café Medina and play a lot of music.

item.title: Broadcast on 01-Mar-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 7 - Jordie is joined by Rich Sexton to discuss food maps, donuts are reviewed, paneer is made, food vlogs are discussed.

item.title: Broadcast on 16-Feb-2012
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 6 - Jordie is sick and makes wontons, Ben Lai discusses food in New York, and Brenda plays local bands.

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Feb-2012
item.description: First episode, asking food critic Andrew Morrison about doing a proper review, interviewing Harry Hertscheg, ED of the Playhouse Wine Festival about developing one's palate and CiTR of old, and CiTR's Fundrive!
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 1 - Food critic Andrew Morrison discusses food reviewing, Harry Hertscheg donates to CiTR and Brenda and Jordie launch their show.

item.title: Broadcast on 14-Feb-2012
item.description: In which Alex and Jessica, from the band Village, discuss music and pizza.
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 3 - in which Al and Jessica from Village discuss Vancouver pizza, Darcy reviews Twisted Fork, and Laura Best talks about community support agriculture.

item.title: Broadcast on 02-Feb-2012
item.description: Brenda and Jordie with special guest Prophecy Sun who talks about her many music projects. Also includes reviews of Wild Rice, Legacy Liquor store's new spirits event, and children reviewing restaurants as part of Push Festival.
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 5 - in which Prophecy Sun discuss music and her former life as a restauranteur, Darcy reviews Wild Rice, Jordie goes to a tasting at Legacy and school kids review gastown eats as part of the Push Festival.

item.title: Broadcast on 19-Jan-2012
item.description: Jordie hosts special guest Kevin Chong who talks about chinese food and whisky. Also includes reviews of Maenam and Pizzeria Barbarella, and of course local music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 4 - in which author Kevin Chong discusses chinese food and whiskey, with reviews of Maenam and Pizzeria Barbarella.

item.title: Broadcast on 08-Dec-2011
item.description: An interview about turkeys, cooking for large groups, and lots of local music.
item.itunes:subtitle: Episode 2 - in which Brenda calls a butcher, Jordie makes macaroni for a large group, and we play local music.
